claim: Flublok is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).

extracted_evidence.quote: The vaccine (Flublok used in this study consisted of puri- ed hemagglutinin (HA) proteins produced in insect cells using baculo virus expression system as previously described [9].
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote directly states that Flublok is produced by expressing hemagglutinin (HA) proteins in insect cells using a baculovirus expression system, which matches the claim about the novel production platform.

extracted_evidence.quote: Genes were cloned into baculo virus using RT-PCR from the same CDC- eri ved vaccine seed viruses used for the production of licensed nactivated influenza vaccine for that year.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote provides evidence that the production process involves cloning genes into baculovirus, which is a key step in the baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS) described in the claim.

extracted_evidence.quote: Expression of proteins in insect cells using recombinant baculo virus expression system has been shown to be a promising alternative to egg-based vaccine production.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote affirms that the production platform for Flublok involves expressing proteins in insect cells using a recombinant baculovirus system, supporting the claim of a novel BEVS-based platform.
